name: Panax Ginseng
summary: Panax ginseng is an adaptogenic herb traditionally used in East Asian medicine to improve energy, resilience to stress, cognitive performance, and overall well-being.
description: Panax ginseng, also called Asian or Korean ginseng, contains active compounds known as ginsenosides that exert effects on the nervous system, endocrine system, and immune regulation. It has been used for centuries as a tonic to enhance vitality, reduce fatigue, and promote mental clarity. Modern research suggests potential benefits in stress adaptation, cognitive function, fatigue reduction, and mood regulation. Evidence is mixed, with some randomized trials showing improvements in energy and attention, while psychiatric benefits remain exploratory.

metadata.natural_source: Root of Panax ginseng (Asian/Korean ginseng plant)
metadata.fda_status: Dietary supplement (not FDA-approved for medical indications)

off_label_uses: Adjunctive use for depressive symptoms (limited evidence)

items: May enhance cognitive function and attention
Potential role in mood and sexual health

sections.text: The ginsenosides in Panax ginseng modulate the hypothalamic–pituitary–adrenal (HPA) axis, regulate neurotransmitters (dopamine, serotonin, acetylcholine), and influence nitric oxide pathways, contributing to stress resilience, energy metabolism, and cognitive support.

adult.note: Higher doses may increase risk of insomnia or overstimulation.

sections.pediatric: Not routinely recommended outside research settings.

sections.text: Effects on fatigue and energy may appear within days to weeks; cognitive and mood effects may require several weeks of use.

other: Avoid evening dosing to reduce risk of insomnia.
May interact with stimulants, anticoagulants, and hypoglycemic agents.
Use cautiously in people with cardiovascular disease.

sections.pregnancy: Insufficient safety data; avoid unless prescribed
sections.pediatrics: Not recommended due to lack of safety data
sections.geriatrics: May be beneficial for fatigue; monitor blood pressure and interactions

sections.text: Not required, but some practitioners recommend cycling (e.g., 6–12 weeks on, 1–2 weeks off) to maintain effectiveness.

items: Panax ginseng is distinct from American ginseng (Panax quinquefolius) and Siberian ginseng (Eleutherococcus senticosus).
Standardized extracts (4–7% ginsenosides) are preferred for consistent results.
Some evidence supports use for cancer-related fatigue, but results are mixed.
